result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric E. Hamer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eric E. Hamer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Eric E. Hamer was found guilty of Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • Eric E. Hamer was found guilty of Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Eric E. Hamer in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Defendant Eric E. Hamer in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances.  No additions or corrections to the PSI.  State speaks to the court re: sentencing.  Atty Schlough speaks re: sentencing.  Defendant speaks to the court. Court speaks re: sentencing.

Count 1 & 2--3 years probation.

No contact w/ the Nelson Family. 
Any and all other condtions the DOC imposes. + DNA Sample and Surchage + costs

Count 2-3 years probation.


15 CT 37--State moves to dismissed. Motion is granted.

February 23, 2016							Hon. Eugene Harrington
State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Hamer	
Jury Trial							      Court Reporter: Cathy Colbert
15 CF 92

Defendant Eric Hamer appears with Attorney Scott Schlough.  Thomas H. Frost appears for the State of Wisconsin.  On record @ 8:53-Court calls case and appearances.  State speaks to the court.  Atty Schlough speaks to the court.  Court speaks to the parties.  Court speaks to Mr. Hamer. Mr. Hamer speaks to the court.  Court orders Atty Schlough to speak to his client. Off record @ 8:56am.  Back on record @ 8:59am.  Court speaks to the defendant. The defendant choses the court to determine the repeater status. Court finds that the stipulation is fair and reasonable. 
State moves to dismiss count 3. Court grants motion and dismisses count 3. 
Court speaks re: witnesses and voir dire questioning.  Court speaks re: jury instructions.  Off record at 9:06am. 
On record at 9:12am Court calls case and appearances.  Clerk swears in all jurors.  Court speaks to all jurors.  Court reviews criminal complaint to jurors.  Court begins questioning.   Juror #364-speaks to court. Juror #412 speaks to the court.  Court excuses Juror #412. Clerk calls Juror #230. Juror #230 speaks to the court.  Juror #230 excused.  Clerk calls Juror #25.  Juror #1269 speaks to court.  Juror #551 speaks to the court.  Juror #551 excused. Clerk calls Juror #1170. Juror #633 speaks to the court. Juror #1109 speaks to the court.  Juror #1269 speaks to the court. Jurors #211, #364, #1269 speak to the court.   State questions jurors.  No further questions from the state. Atty Schlough speaks to the jurors.  Attorneys strike the jurors. 12 jurors are chosen.  Court speaks to the remainder jurors.  Off record at 9:50am.  
Back on record at 10:00am.  Jurors enter the courtroom.  Court speaks to jurors and reviews case. State gives opening statement.  Atty Schlough gives opening statement.  State calls L.N to the stand.  Clerk swears in L.N. state begins questioning.  Atty Schlough objects. Court orders jury to stand down.  Objection is over ruled.  Jury is seated. State begins questioning. No futher questions from the state. Cross from Atty Schlough. Nothing further from Attorney Schlough. Witness is excused.  State calls E.N. to the stand.  Clerk swears in E.N. State begins questioning.  Nothing further from the state. Cross from Atty Schlough.  No further questions from Atty Schlough. Redirect from the State. Witness is excused.   State calls J. N. to the stand. Clerk swears in J.N. State begins questioning.  No further questions from the state. Cross from Atty Schlough.  Nothing further. Witness is excused.  Off record at 11:06. Back on record at 11:14. State call Officer Dave Bos to the stand.  Clerk swears in Officer Bos. State begins questioning.  Nothing further from the state. Cross from Atty Schlough.  Redirect from the State. Recross. Nothing further. Witness is excused. Jury stands down. Atty Schlough speaks to the court requesting a motion to dismiss count 2. Atty Schlough makes argument.  State makes statement.  Motion is denied.   Court speaks to the defendant re: testifying.   Court finds that the defendant freely and knowingly waives his right to be silent and will testify.  Court calls Jury back into court room.  Atty Schlough calls Eric Hamer to the stand.  Clerk swears in Mr. Hamer. Atty Schlough begins questioning.  Cross from the state. Redirect from Atty Schlough.   No further questions. Witness is excused. State recalls Officer Bos. State begins questioning. No further questions. Witness is excused.  Witness is closed.   Jury is excused.  Off record at 11:53am. 
On record at 1:18-Review of Jury Instructions.  Off record at 1:22pm. Back on record at 1:26pm Jury returns. Court begins Jury instructions.  State begins closing argument. Closing argument from Atty Schlough.  Rebuttal from the state.   State reads verdict instructions.  Clerk swears in bailiff.  Jury stands down for deliberations.  Off record at 2:21.    Back on record at 2:44pm.  Court reviews questions from the Jury.  Question marked exhibit A.  Court calls Jury back in.  Court speaks to Jury, answers questions.  Off record at 2:49 On record at 3:10pm. Jury has reached a verdict.  
Count 1-Jury finds the def. guilty. Court finds that the verdict is unanimous.  Court accepts the verdict. 
Count 2-Jury finds the def. guilty. Court finds that the verdict is unanimous. Court accepts the verdict. 
Court releases the Jury.  
Court directs the clerk to enter judgment.  Court orders a PSI.  Court revokes the defendants bail.  Defendant is to remain in the custody of the sheriff.  

Sentencing- April 11, 2016 @ 11:00am.

Defendant, Eric E. Hamer appeared with Attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  Also has 15 CT 37. Court rejects plea agreement.  Set for trial.
of Filing of Discovery with Court

Jury trial at 02-23-2016 08:15 am.

Set for Jury in felony file.  CT will track.  Jury trial scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, Eric E. Hamer appeared with Attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.
11:06 am Court recites cases 15 CF 92/15CT37 & app; DA calls Officer Dave Bos - sworn & testifies, identifies deft, cont'd testimony; Atty S - cross; DA - nothing, witness excused; Atty S - nothing; DA - statement; Atty S - statement; COURT - finds prob cause, Da tenders Info - Court recites cts; Atty S - waives reading, NG plea; Court - accepts plea, subst Aug 28, def motions 10/2; status conference 10/5 at 11 am.  bail cont.  15 CT 37 tracks.  Adj'd 11:11 am.  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant, Eric E. Hamer appeared with Attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances. Also has 15 CT 37.  Waived reading in 15 CT 37-Not guilty plea is entered.  
15 CF 92  Waived reading.  Preliminary hearing is needed.  Waive time limits.  Bail will continue.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 11:00 am.
No Contact w/ E.N.  or J.N    Curfew 9pm to 6am.

Defendant, Eric E. Hamer appeared.  Court calls case and appearances.  Also has 15 CT 37.  Waived reading.  Prelim needed in 15 CF 97.  Count 3  Not guilty plea is entered on count 3.  
15 CT 37-- Waived reading, Not guilty plea is entered.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 09:30 am.
